# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia function clean_column(col)
    col = strip(col) # remove leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = lowercase(col) # convert to lowercase
    col = replace(col, r"[-\s]+" => "_") # replace spaces and hyphens with underscore
    clean_column
end
```

This function `clean_column` accepts a single argument `col` which is the column name. It first removes any leading and trailing whitespaces using the `strip` function. Then, it converts the entire string to lowercase using the `lowercase` function. Finally, it replaces any occurrences of one or more spaces or hyphens with a single underscore using a regular expression pattern in the `replace` function. The function returns the cleaned column name.
